items.content_html: I‚Äôm kinda over stationary. Once you‚Äôve tried a bunch of things and realised that you have what suits your needs (and more), the continued hunt becomes hoarding. I have one big purchase left before I close the book on this hobby for a while.
I always end up surfing the web looking at a bunch of awesome t-shirts. Then I realise that they‚Äôre all super expensive (once you add shipping) and just close the tab depressed.
The John Lewis Christmas adverts are an institution. The latest one is by far one of my absolute favourites.

Totally underwhelmed by the new Field Notes Winter release, Clandestine. The video though has got the best production values I‚Äôve seen from them. Not for me though, as I‚Äôve got enough FNs to last me 3-4 years at least.
Great trailer for Toy Story 4. I only found out that this was happening earlier this morning. Had the same feeling as Duckie there, alas they‚Äôve won me over.
He had a great run, but alas Stan Lee has died.
First rain have come with thunder and lightning. It‚Äôs been such a long time since we‚Äôve had any rainfall in the Gulf.
The Crescent.
Awesome analysis of why tech companies are making custom typefaces.

items.title: Podcasts for November
items.content_html:
üéôÔ∏è Seeing as I‚Äôm in the car for many hours of the day (travelling up and down to Abu Dhabi), I‚Äôve been listening to a ton of podcasts recently‚Ä¶.a metric ton in fact. Here are some of the highlight episodes:

  1. Unfiltered interview with Sir Nick Clegg - essential listening if you‚Äôre looking to understand Brexit more.
  2. Serial Season Three - I missed season 2, but this season has been very good.
  3. Song Exploder - John Carpenter Halloween Theme - Was made even better as we drove in pitch darkness on a moonless night.
  4. Broken Record - Hey, it‚Äôs Malcolm Gladwell.
Park season is upon us.

The weekend is finally upon us and as always I‚Äôm hopeful of filling it with good activities for both myself and the rest of the family. It‚Äôs not so much living for the weekend as it making the most of the weekends which offer more time than the week.
It‚Äôs been an exceptionally tough week, which is to be expected as everyone is working on overdrive towards the imminent opening for Qasr Al Hosn in Abu Dhabi. Great video on the Twitter feed.

Finding your niche can feel like a life long struggle. Some discover it early on and continue to build on that discovery. Others meander through life until they settle. While other due to circumstance or ability never reach that discovery. You have one life. Go. Discover.

This weekend‚Äôs mini project was making an adjustable snake knot camera strap. Went for some funky colours as the paracord on offer had limited colours available. If you have to go bold, go all the way.

All of my writing happens in iAWriter. All of my editing is happening in the Hemingway app. If you‚Äôve not used this app, go read the help section first then give it a try on something you‚Äôve written. It‚Äôs eye-opening.

As much as I love October, really glad it‚Äôs finally over and can look forward to what November has to bring. Winter is finally upon us and I‚Äôm looking forward to enjoying the outdoors a little bit more. With both boys in tow I‚Äôm hoping for a bunch of fun over the next 6 months.

First proper halloween experience for Zane, which he absolutely loved. Got dressed as a pterodactyl, hunted for houses with their lights on and then stuffing his bucket with goodies. I‚Äôve never been into Halloween, but starting to enjoy it through my kid‚Äôs eyes.

This new iPad Pro is a great way to finally get into the iPad lifestyle. Glad I waited out for this version (rather than getting one last year). Hopefully it‚Äôll be my upgraded computing device for the next five years.
If you‚Äôre looking for a great alternative to the standard Apple case for your iPhone 6, 6s, 7 and 8, look no further than the Puro Icon case. Got mine in an amazing aquamarine colour.

If you‚Äôre struggling to write on your site, then consider a trick I‚Äôve been using this year. I write for myself and 1 other person that doesn‚Äôt exist, except in my mind. He likes similar things as me, and my site is how I share small messages with him.
Inktober #005 continues.
Inktober is nearly over. This one was done while I was on the phone.
